Using re.compile() and saving the resulting regular expression object
for reuse is more efficient when the expression will be used several
times in a single program. [1]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#re.compile

Change-Id: I9cc0d3261e6f66cdb547beadc2b3efe626084d56
'}]
commit_message:
Globalize regex objects

Using re.compile() and saving the resulting regular expression object
for reuse is more efficient when the expression will be used several
times in a single program. [1]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#re.compile

Change-Id: I9cc0d3261e6f66cdb547beadc2b3efe626084d56

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-14 04:10:55.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/database/mongodb-base.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/systemd-d9a41bb3709d0653.yaml', 'puppet/services/database/mysql.yaml'], 'message': "Disable systemd-networkd & systemd-resolved

Latest commits in puppet-systemd enabled by default systemd-networkd and
systemd-resolved but we don't want to manage them for now in TripleO.
MySQL and MongoDB services were managing some systemd resources so now
we ensure that these 2 systemd services are disabled. In the future, we
might want and activate these services and revert that patch but for now
we want to disable them.

Change-Id: I42c6c9b643a71a0fbb1768bbae91e8bfa916ea00
Closes-Bug: #1704145
"}]
commit_message:
Disable systemd-networkd & systemd-resolved

Latest commits in puppet-systemd enabled by default systemd-networkd and
systemd-resolved but we don't want to manage them for now in TripleO.
MySQL and MongoDB services were managing some systemd resources so now
we ensure that these 2 systemd services are disabled. In the future, we
might want and activate these services and revert that patch but for now
we want to disable them.

Change-Id: I42c6c9b643a71a0fbb1768bbae91e8bfa916ea00
Closes-Bug: #1704145

commit_message:
Add new option 'show-resources' to dos.py

Show total and per-node maximum vcpu, memory and storage capacity
usage, if defined.
It will help to plan the CI hardware usage mode carefully.

Example:

  $ dos.py show-resources test-environment-name

Change-Id: I1bb891ef394d74b06e07c667fc88139377c8c96f

commit_message:
Fix tools/cleanup-images script error

When cleanup-images is launch without parameters the following error is
triggered:
./cleanup-images: line 72: break: only meaningful in a `for', `while',
or `until' loop

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Ie8c63420a4e9b0d49a4e6be4172c8f0be912b556
Closes-Bug: #1702496

subject: Fix searchlight nova resources indexation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-10 18:47:47.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/searchlight/templates/searchlight.conf.j2'], 'message': "Fix searchlight nova resources indexation

* nova_server resources resources are not actually
indexed.

* nova flavor are not indexed too, cause the notifications topic for
flavors is versioned_notifications.
We need to config notifications_topics_exchanges with value
'versioned_notifications,nova' in order to get the related versioned.

Change-Id: Ibf4ee7d7efceee5aefac5f83e22b994ae33ce047
Closes-Bug: #1703435
"}]
commit_message:
Fix searchlight nova resources indexation

* nova_server resources resources are not actually
indexed.

* nova flavor are not indexed too, cause the notifications topic for
flavors is versioned_notifications.
We need to config notifications_topics_exchanges with value
'versioned_notifications,nova' in order to get the related versioned.

Change-Id: Ibf4ee7d7efceee5aefac5f83e22b994ae33ce047
Closes-Bug: #1703435

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-10 19:46:35.000000000', 'files': ['{{cookiecutter.repo_name}}/doc/source/conf.py', '{{cookiecutter.repo_name}}/{{cookiecutter.module_name}}/__init__.py', '{{cookiecutter.repo_name}}/releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Fix errors found from making a project

The pbr version is tied to the repo-name - that is, the name that we
register with PyPI. It takes the argument 'python-novaclient' not
'novaclient'.

Nothing we do is Copyright OpenStack Foundation. There isn't a good
answer for a single-line copyright statement such as is found in sphinx
config files, but "OpenStack Foundation" is definitely wrong.

Add some line wrapping so that the releasenotes conf file doesn't fail
pep8.

Change-Id: Id237331c279b7acb848a28d167ad88d63de6f140
'}]
commit_message:
Fix errors found from making a project

The pbr version is tied to the repo-name - that is, the name that we
register with PyPI. It takes the argument 'python-novaclient' not
'novaclient'.

Nothing we do is Copyright OpenStack Foundation. There isn't a good
answer for a single-line copyright statement such as is found in sphinx
config files, but "OpenStack Foundation" is definitely wrong.

Add some line wrapping so that the releasenotes conf file doesn't fail
pep8.

Change-Id: Id237331c279b7acb848a28d167ad88d63de6f140

commit_message:
Update TripleO UI config template.

The default template to configure the UI
should be using TLS as quickstart use it by
default, also we use it downstream by default.

Having the old template schema makes a little bit
confuse how the endpoints should be configured.

Change-Id: I165622ae04d32398ecb76df3908c3a3fe602e18b

commit_message:
Limit maximum pending resizes for preventing over quota

A config option for 'max_pending_resizes' has been added to the 'quota'
group. When a user reverts a resize to a smaller flavor, there is a
possibility of exceeding cores and ram quota because quota is not
checked during a revert, so as not to block reverts.

Part of cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: Ieea23c6fc4aefbfd5771e5c44415137e4f72256c

subject: Fix typo in haproxy bundle
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-13 12:20:34.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/pacemaker/haproxy_bundle.pp'], 'message': 'Fix typo in haproxy bundle

Change I6f4d3a5abae8f1781cfe6f69ff960aad500061e3 slipped in a typo
and it removed the '$' character from a puppet manifest. Which causes
a deployment to fail with:
INFO: running container haproxy-bundle-docker-0 for the first time
ERROR: /usr/bin/docker-current: Error response from daemon: Invalid bind mount spec "deployed_ssl_cert_path:deployed_ssl_cert_path:ro": Invalid volume destination path: 'deployed_ssl_cert_path' mount path must be absolute.. See '/usr/bin/docker-current run --help'.
ERROR: docker failed to launch container

Change-Id: Ic602fd443d38482bf1f924531561b2174dc38293
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in haproxy bundle

Change I6f4d3a5abae8f1781cfe6f69ff960aad500061e3 slipped in a typo
and it removed the '$' character from a puppet manifest. Which causes
a deployment to fail with:
INFO: running container haproxy-bundle-docker-0 for the first time
ERROR: /usr/bin/docker-current: Error response from daemon: Invalid bind mount spec "deployed_ssl_cert_path:deployed_ssl_cert_path:ro": Invalid volume destination path: 'deployed_ssl_cert_path' mount path must be absolute.. See '/usr/bin/docker-current run --help'.
ERROR: docker failed to launch container

Change-Id: Ic602fd443d38482bf1f924531561b2174dc38293

commit_message:
Use oslo.polcy DocumentedRuleDefault

Remove the in tree hack of create_rule_default, and call through to the
official oslo implementation of either DocumentedRuleDefault or
RuleDefault depending on if a list of API operations is required.

Change-Id: I9cb184c30f7af4f8ef937aa4ca388c42c427ca4e
Implements: blueprint policy-docs

commit_message:
Calculation of interface types from templates fixed

  In case of adding port on bond 'ether' type was set
for interface. This was root cause of the issue -
bond was processed as nic.
  This patch was based on [1] patch, but it was
adapted for 'mitaka'.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391410/

Closes-Bug: #1602817

Change-Id: I2fb14eac3874796bfb099db0b681db253351850c

The nova_api_galera_user is granted privileges for both the
nova_api_galera_database and nova_cell0_database. Use append_privs for
both of these tasks so that privileges aren't being overwritten and
re-added on each run of the playbook.

Change-Id: Ide9d44582bd1ecc126d198089ae9879163f61808
(cherry picked from commit 5c918b4592e7df3c75bac91f88b2c578d9d47e77)

commit_message:
Idempotent nova db privilege grants

The nova_api_galera_user is granted privileges for both the
nova_api_galera_database and nova_cell0_database. Use append_privs for
both of these tasks so that privileges aren't being overwritten and
re-added on each run of the playbook.

Change-Id: Ide9d44582bd1ecc126d198089ae9879163f61808
(cherry picked from commit 5c918b4592e7df3c75bac91f88b2c578d9d47e77)

Use update_firewall policy for add/remove router operation

In the REST API, add/remove_router operations are PUT operation,
so using 'update_firewall' policy definition looks better.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1106, 'name': 'Ricardo Carrillo Cruz', 'email': 'ricardo.carrillo.cruz@gmail.com', 'username': 'rcc'}, {'_account_id': 3099, 'name': 'David Shrewsbury', 'email': 'dshrewsb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dshrews'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 8406, 'name': 'Reik Keutterling', 'email': 'reik.keutterling@telekom.de', 'username': 'spielkind'}, {'_account_id': 9624, 'name': 'Ramy Asselin', 'email': 'ramyasselin@yahoo.com', 'username': 'asselin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-12 14:57:44.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'shade/meta.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_rebuild_server.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_create_server.py'], 'message': 'Add floating IPs to server dict ourselves

The nova/neutron interaction as it relates to updating the network info
cache in nova apparently does not believe in an object reality and
instead prefers to think of things as unrealized quantum superpositions.
While those are great for particle physics, they make getting the
address of the server hard. It therefore follows that we should
undertake the burden of providing consistent and objective information
about the floating ip of the server ourselves, regardless of the sadness
this adds to the world.

Change-Id: I75ba0318c9a5a011b5a530d86ace275f19511f1f
'}]
commit_message:
Add floating IPs to server dict ourselves

The nova/neutron interaction as it relates to updating the network info
cache in nova apparently does not believe in an object reality and
instead prefers to think of things as unrealized quantum superpositions.
While those are great for particle physics, they make getting the
address of the server hard. It therefore follows that we should
undertake the burden of providing consistent and objective information
about the floating ip of the server ourselves, regardless of the sadness
this adds to the world.

Change-Id: I75ba0318c9a5a011b5a530d86ace275f19511f1f

commit_message:
Remove special-case of memcache node ips for ipv6

This should be handled in puppet-tripleo, as is done for some other
services e.g ceph.  This has also been identified as a possible
performance problem due to the nested get_attr calls.

Change-Id: I7e14f0219c28c023c4e8e1d4693f0bfa9674d801

    * Push static route for 169.254.169.254 in DHCP options.
    * Wait until metadata service is provisioned in the chassis where
      a port resides before sending the event to Nova.

Agent:

    * Implementation of [0].

Devstack plugin:

    * Starts networking-ovn-agent with the proper config files.
    * Disables config drive in nova.conf for tempest against master
      branch.
    * Enables TEMPEST_RUN_VALIDATION for tempest against master branch.

In order to test this patch out we need to make these changes to
nova.conf:

    * [DEFAULT] section:
      force_config_drive = False
    * [neutron] section:
      service_metadata_proxy = True

This patch depends on [1] and [2] (already merged into OVS master).
NOTE: Metadata tests are only enabled for the non-voting tempest job
      which runs against OVS master branch. The release job runs against
      OVS 2.7 which doesn't include [1][2] so those tests are disabled
      until OVS 2.8 is released.

[0]
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-ovn/design/metadata_api.html
[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/767369/

commit_message:
Metadata agent support in networking-ovn

Initial implementation

Changes in the mechanism driver:

    * Automatically create a port with device_owner=network:dhcp to
      serve metadata and eventually DHCP.
    * Auto-allocate an IP for the metadata port on subnet creation.
    * Push static route for 169.254.169.254 in DHCP options.
    * Wait until metadata service is provisioned in the chassis where
      a port resides before sending the event to Nova.

Agent:

    * Implementation of [0].

Devstack plugin:

    * Starts networking-ovn-agent with the proper config files.
    * Disables config drive in nova.conf for tempest against master
      branch.
    * Enables TEMPEST_RUN_VALIDATION for tempest against master branch.

In order to test this patch out we need to make these changes to
nova.conf:

    * [DEFAULT] section:
      force_config_drive = False
    * [neutron] section:
      service_metadata_proxy = True

This patch depends on [1] and [2] (already merged into OVS master).
NOTE: Metadata tests are only enabled for the non-voting tempest job
      which runs against OVS master branch. The release job runs against
      OVS 2.7 which doesn't include [1][2] so those tests are disabled
      until OVS 2.8 is released.

[0]
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-ovn/design/metadata_api.html
[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/767369/
[2] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/771297/

Change-Id: Ife2fd18f2f88050429e70c7e557fa41d2d54b034

commit_message:
Remove .testrepository/times.dbm

When we run tox -e py27 command and after that
we run tox -e py35 command, we will meet with
test fail problem like: "No module named gdbm".
This patch adds cleaning up of this file
before running next tests.

Change-Id: I35a20521706b19a3067a5579c9dcf46efd0d55c0

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-13 06:50:19.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Make puppet-openstackci beaker jobs voting

For some reason puppet-openstackci was singled out as nonvoting,

this patch cleans it up.

Change-Id: I1b8705e43612f46220d83cf7d368ea143ecde7dc

commit_message:
Make puppet-openstackci beaker jobs voting

For some reason puppet-openstackci was singled out as nonvoting,
probably because it was one of the first repos to get this job in the
first place. We missed it in the make-beaker-voting-everywhere patch, so
this patch cleans it up.

Change-Id: I1b8705e43612f46220d83cf7d368ea143ecde7dc

commit_message:
Add ovsdbapp to PROJECTS

This patch is adding ovsdbapp to the $PROJECTS variable so it can be
installed from git, without it the job fails with:

The /opt/stack/new/ovsdbapp project was not found; if this is a gate job,
add the project to the $PROJECTS variable in the job definition.

Change-Id: I5b60222090b3f4827091b7a96d8696adb8e12c7f

commit_message:
Add networking-sfc to PROJECTS for Tricircle

Driver for networking-sfc has been added to Tricircle, need to
add networking-sfc to PROJECTS variable to allow DevStack to
clone networking-sfc so Tricircle's dsvm test can proceed.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-13 20:50:35.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/jenkins-sudo-grep.sh'], 'message': 'scripts: jenkins-sudo-grep: Look at /var/log/messages for sudo logs

The rsyslog package on openSUSE uses /var/log/messages for the sudo logs
so add this file as an alternative to the auth.log and secure ones.

Change-Id: I1af5a7a56590935585ac9684d90c2e7c90f09975
'}]
commit_message:
scripts: jenkins-sudo-grep: Look at /var/log/messages for sudo logs

The rsyslog package on openSUSE uses /var/log/messages for the sudo logs
so add this file as an alternative to the auth.log and secure ones.

Change-Id: I1af5a7a56590935585ac9684d90c2e7c90f09975

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-21 02:02:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix duplicate Neutron ports on instance reschedule

Because network allocate is an async call, and instance metadata
is updated in place [1], network_allocated tag in instance system metadata
may be removed in some race conditions, so when instance rescheculed
multiple ips will be allocated [2].

[1]:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2820-L2823
[2]:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L1429-L1430

Change-Id: I93c1c447e79c78bf91023cb1231d553351437d9f
Closes-bug: #1609526
'}]
commit_message:
Fix duplicate Neutron ports on instance reschedule

Because network allocate is an async call, and instance metadata
is updated in place [1], network_allocated tag in instance system metadata
may be removed in some race conditions, so when instance rescheculed
multiple ips will be allocated [2].

[1]:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2820-L2823
[2]:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L1429-L1430

Change-Id: I93c1c447e79c78bf91023cb1231d553351437d9f
Closes-bug: #1609526

commit_message:
Correct help in --profile argument

HMAC key of OSprofiler can be configure in config files of Trove
not in api-paste.ini (configs in paste are deprecated).

Change-Id: I4904e5d0104e1cac12cc1f3e6dc38b6ef8372982

subject: Avoid empty print during validation workflow execution
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-30 07:05:10.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/validations.py'], 'message': 'Avoid empty print during validation workflow execution

Workflow check_pre_deployment_validations, sends multiple messages,
as part of the sub workflow execution. If the workflow is success,
there are no messages sent and it will be empty string. Avoid
printing empty strings.

Change-Id: I3f14a3bc97fa1e51230e1f6b1de4ed4fb8205842
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid empty print during validation workflow execution

Workflow check_pre_deployment_validations, sends multiple messages,
as part of the sub workflow execution. If the workflow is success,
there are no messages sent and it will be empty string. Avoid
printing empty strings.

Change-Id: I3f14a3bc97fa1e51230e1f6b1de4ed4fb8205842

commit_message:
Add missing DockerMysqlClientConfigImage

The change Ieaedac33f0a25a352ab432cdb00b5c888be4ba27 requires an entry
so that the heat parameter is populated.

Change-Id: Id724e294eadaf01d61038c6436a383969c4653d7

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-10-19 14:29:54.000000000', 'files': ['etc/freezer/freezer-api.conf.sample', 'freezer_api/common/config.py', 'requirements.txt', 'devstack/lib/freezer-api'], 'message': 'Request service token using identity v3

This patch makes freezer-api request its service token to an Identity v3
endpoint (using Password plugin) and adds Password options to the config
sample file.

Change-Id: I37cec5564589f83fc4020fbc9269730ab0882b3f
'}]
commit_message:
Request service token using identity v3

This patch makes freezer-api request its service token to an Identity v3
endpoint (using Password plugin) and adds Password options to the config
sample file.

Change-Id: I37cec5564589f83fc4020fbc9269730ab0882b3f

commit_message:
[Gate] Remove releases older than Boron

There's no gate jobs to test these releases anymore, removing them to
simplify the gate scripts

Change-Id: I613827dccb979b7a14b200aee98c963e663dea08

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I225da4f95187387007df11c91047497a2a93e862
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I225da4f95187387007df11c91047497a2a93e862

commit_message:
import content from cli-reference in openstack-manuals

The following commands are provided by the neutron repo,
so the corresponding CLI references are imported here.

- neutron-sanity-check
- neutron-debug

The purpose of this commit is just to import the CLI reference
related to the neutron repo as-is.

commit_message:
Linking Vitrage Install Guide in the Install Guide

This is an attempt to add Vitrage Install Guide to the
RDO part of the Install Guide for Ocata. As I could not follow the
instructions from [1] this change is totally my invention :)
For Pike this is happening automatically after has_install_guide
property added to the project in www/project-data/latest.yaml.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/project-install-guide.html

Change-Id: I067d89324f3f820396b9c7f234e6a35513dedfca
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

subject: Suppress oslo-config DeprecationWarning during functional test
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-27 12:07:04.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': "Suppress oslo-config DeprecationWarning during functional test

During functional tests, the following warning appears:
    /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py:2605:
    DeprecationWarning: The argument enforce_type is changing
    its default value to True and then will be removed completely,
    please fix the invalid String(choices=('file', 'filesystem',
    'http', 'https', 'swift', 'swift+http', 'swift+https',
    'swift+config', 'rbd', 'sheepdog', 'cinder', 'vsphere'))
    value '['file']' for option 'default_store'. in version '4.0'

It is due to override with an array, but it should be a string.

Change-Id: I34e7c37de5793c1f68d0eb3933773a325bd33a44
"}]
commit_message:
Suppress oslo-config DeprecationWarning during functional test

During functional tests, the following warning appears:
    /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py:2605:
    DeprecationWarning: The argument enforce_type is changing
    its default value to True and then will be removed completely,
    please fix the invalid String(choices=('file', 'filesystem',
    'http', 'https', 'swift', 'swift+http', 'swift+https',
    'swift+config', 'rbd', 'sheepdog', 'cinder', 'vsphere'))
    value '['file']' for option 'default_store'. in version '4.0'

It is due to override with an array, but it should be a string.

Change-Id: I34e7c37de5793c1f68d0eb3933773a325bd33a44

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-18 07:49:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.module.js'], 'message': 'Attribute "isServer" of images visibility filter should be true.

I found an interesting bug in images panel.
In images panel, set filter to be "visibility: public", I got one
image listed in the table, then I changed language from "en" to
"zh_CN" and filter images again, I got none.

In the tab of browser developer tool, I saw a correct response
with one image data, but it was not appeared in the table. Later
I found the attribute "isServer" of visibility filter is false,
that caused the above bug.

Change-Id: I130d07727fe74ce65aba72d3e63fdfe0c8721795
Closes-Bug: #1691683
'}]
commit_message:
Attribute "isServer" of images visibility filter should be true.

I found an interesting bug in images panel.
In images panel, set filter to be "visibility: public", I got one
image listed in the table, then I changed language from "en" to
"zh_CN" and filter images again, I got none.

In the tab of browser developer tool, I saw a correct response
with one image data, but it was not appeared in the table. Later
I found the attribute "isServer" of visibility filter is false,
that caused the above bug.

Change-Id: I130d07727fe74ce65aba72d3e63fdfe0c8721795
Closes-Bug: #1691683

commit_message:
Only gather facts when necessary

We only need to gather facts once per host, and only
when it's required. Doing it more often just slows
down the deployment.

Change-Id: Id11654218819a544c2b91c636c00374165b16559

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-07 13:07:38.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/tests/unit/test_exception.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove PY34 and add PY35 environment in tox

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial [1], where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

[1] Please refer to "Python 3 Status of OpenStack projects": https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
Change-Id: I7992a0c98f190ae6ae2402f41148b7ea48b984dd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove PY34 and add PY35 environment in tox

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial [1], where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

[1] Please refer to "Python 3 Status of OpenStack projects": https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
Change-Id: I7992a0c98f190ae6ae2402f41148b7ea48b984dd

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-14 02:19:29.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/webapi-version-history.rst'], 'message': 'Add Driver API change in 1.33 to history

API Version 1.33 introduced fields related to storage interface to
Driver API as well as Node API. This patch adds missing description
for Driver API to REST API Version History documentation.

commit_message:
Handle volume API version enablement

This is a start to have tempest handle Cinder API versions
based on what is actually enabled. There are currently a
lot of places in the code the assume v1 and v2 are available,
but those versions may be disabled, especially as we try to
get everyone moved onto the latest (final?) v3 API version.

There are more areas that should be fixed up before we can
actually just work with v3 only, but this is a start to get
there.

Closes-bug: #1703044
Change-Id: Icc2e12f06c3b4899f934f000e191552f4a5cd2a9

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-07-12 09:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['lib/lvm'], 'message': 'Remove VGs when cleaning LVM up in devstack

This patch adds removing of the volume group
before removing the loopback device and
the backing file when performing LVM cleanup
in unstack.sh

Without this commit:

unstack.sh removes logical volumes, removes the
loopback devices and deletes the backing file
but leaves a dangling volume group

  $ ./stack.sh && ./unstack.sh
  $ sudo vgs
  VG                    #PV #LV #SN Attr   VSize  VFree
  stack-volumes-default   1   0   0 wz--n- 10.01g 10.01g
  $ sudo losetup -a
  $ sudo vgremove stack-volumes-default
  /dev/loop0: lseek 4096 failed: Invalid argument
  vg_remove_mdas stack-volumes-default failed

With this commit:

unstack.sh removes volume groups after removing
all logical volumes but before removing
the loopback device and deleting the backing file

Partial-Bug: 1441236
Change-Id: Id9c06fa50f6cad28764f5a3396f559cac9999649'}]
commit_message:
Remove VGs when cleaning LVM up in devstack

This patch adds removing of the volume group
before removing the loopback device and
the backing file when performing LVM cleanup
in unstack.sh

Without this commit:

unstack.sh removes logical volumes, removes the
loopback devices and deletes the backing file
but leaves a dangling volume group

  $ ./stack.sh && ./unstack.sh
  $ sudo vgs
  VG                    #PV #LV #SN Attr   VSize  VFree
  stack-volumes-default   1   0   0 wz--n- 10.01g 10.01g
  $ sudo losetup -a
  $ sudo vgremove stack-volumes-default
  /dev/loop0: lseek 4096 failed: Invalid argument
  vg_remove_mdas stack-volumes-default failed

With this commit:

unstack.sh removes volume groups after removing
all logical volumes but before removing
the loopback device and deleting the backing file

Partial-Bug: 1441236
Change-Id: Id9c06fa50f6cad28764f5a3396f559cac9999649

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-cells endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds os-cells related routes by a plain list,
instead of using stevedore.

After all the Nova API endpoints moves to the plain routes list,
the usage of stevedore for API loading will be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Iec6e720b4e225251ce06ddfecb316569f9260913

commit_message:
Add 'then' support to green thread pool executor (WIP)

The ability to have a future run some function and
then (depending on succcess or failure) run another
function (and return a future for that result) and
so-on makes for some nice chaining of future execution
so in the executor that we are able to add this ability
add it.

Example that can be used to try this:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/473820/

Change-Id: Ie37a5964c4fa514a211fc4700867e876d9704fc1

subject: Support pagination for resource routing list operations
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11819, 'name': 'Chaoyi Huang', 'email': 'joehuang@huawei.com', 'username': 'joehuang'}, {'_account_id': 12076, 'name': 'Zhiyuan Cai', 'email': 'luckyvega.g@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhiyuan_cai'}, {'_account_id': 19960, 'name': 'newypei', 'email': 'newypei@gmail.com', 'username': 'newypei'}, {'_account_id': 21023, 'name': 'Ronghui Cao', 'email': 'CR_hui@126.com', 'username': 'CR_hui'}, {'_account_id': 21033, 'name': 'XiongQiu Long', 'email': 'longxiongqiu123@163.com', 'username': 'XiongQiu'}, {'_account_id': 22738, 'name': 'hejiawei', 'email': 'j452577895@163.com', 'username': 'hjw'}, {'_account_id': 26179, 'name': 'Fangming Liu', 'email': 'frank_openstack@163.com', 'username': 'frank_fml'}, {'_account_id': 26235, 'name': 'Lyman Xu', 'email': 'xu_lyman@163.com', 'username': 'lyman-xu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2017-07-12 09:10:08.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/db/api.py', 'tricircle/common/constants.py', 'tricircle/common/utils.py', 'tricircle/api/app.py', 'tricircle/tests/base.py', 'tricircle/api/controllers/routing.py', 'tricircle/db/core.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/api/controllers/test_routing.py'], 'message': "Support pagination for resource routing list operations

1. What is the problem
The resource routing list operations will retrieve all the items in
the database, which will consume too much memory and take long time
to response when the results are considerably large.

2. What is the solution for the problem
To reduce load on the service, list operations will return a maximum
number of items at a time by pagination. To navigate the collection,
the parameters limit and marker can be set in the URI. For example:

/v1.0/routings?limit=2000&marker=500

The marker parameter is the ID of the last item in the previous list.
A marker with an invalid ID returns a badRequest (400) fault.
The limit parameter sets the page size. These parameters are optional.
If the client requests a limit beyond the maximum limit configured by
the deployment, the server returns the maximum limit number of items.
Pagination and filtering can work together with routing's list operations.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Add pagination feature for resource routing list operations.

Change-Id: I05d1b30f502103d247d8be06c1e52fdcec42b41e
"}]
commit_message:
Support pagination for resource routing list operations

1. What is the problem
The resource routing list operations will retrieve all the items in
the database, which will consume too much memory and take long time
to response when the results are considerably large.

2. What is the solution for the problem
To reduce load on the service, list operations will return a maximum
number of items at a time by pagination. To navigate the collection,
the parameters limit and marker can be set in the URI. For example:

/v1.0/routings?limit=2000&marker=500

The marker parameter is the ID of the last item in the previous list.
A marker with an invalid ID returns a badRequest (400) fault.
The limit parameter sets the page size. These parameters are optional.
If the client requests a limit beyond the maximum limit configured by
the deployment, the server returns the maximum limit number of items.
Pagination and filtering can work together with routing's list operations.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Add pagination feature for resource routing list operations.

Change-Id: I05d1b30f502103d247d8be06c1e52fdcec42b41e

commit_message:
Add the upper constraints to package versions

Currently tox does not have any upper constraints, due to which there is a
possibility of tox to use a newer version of dependent library that may not
be supported yet. This patch add the upper constrainsts as set by the
openstack/requirements repository

Change-Id: I89ab7199844541526166f77724d95c60713ccca7

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-14 06:06:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/tests/test_api.py', 'oslo_vmware/api.py'], 'message': "Add a locale param to allow vSphere SDK locale specification.

Because oslo.vmware driver does not allow locale specification
when creating a SDK api session, the api session will use the
default locale settings of the Managed-to vCenter.

In this case, if vCenter's locale is Chinese, the vCenter
will throw out error messages in Chinese of Unicode if some nova
actions fail, something like following in nova-compute.log:

VMwareDriverException: \u65e0\u6548\u7684\u6570\u636e\u5b58\u50a8
\u8def\u5f84\u201c[datastore_132] vmware_temp/a5635643-331f-4e45-
b5fc-be064c0f7cf6/a62bbf4a-66ea-4426-ab29-ec5299bd1633\u201d\u3002

This message is unreadable for a human being, and the logs are
mixed by English and Chinese.

To avoid such circumstances, we had better enable oslo.vmware to
allow locale specification so that we could use prefered locale.

Closes-bug: #1456118
Change-Id: I8330c6c07c6e959e7af627d777c6e3e171120372
"}]
commit_message:
Add a locale param to allow vSphere SDK locale specification.

Because oslo.vmware driver does not allow locale specification
when creating a SDK api session, the api session will use the
default locale settings of the Managed-to vCenter.

In this case, if vCenter's locale is Chinese, the vCenter
will throw out error messages in Chinese of Unicode if some nova
actions fail, something like following in nova-compute.log:

VMwareDriverException: \u65e0\u6548\u7684\u6570\u636e\u5b58\u50a8
\u8def\u5f84\u201c[datastore_132] vmware_temp/a5635643-331f-4e45-
b5fc-be064c0f7cf6/a62bbf4a-66ea-4426-ab29-ec5299bd1633\u201d\u3002

This message is unreadable for a human being, and the logs are
mixed by English and Chinese.

To avoid such circumstances, we had better enable oslo.vmware to
allow locale specification so that we could use prefered locale.

Closes-bug: #1456118
Change-Id: I8330c6c07c6e959e7af627d777c6e3e171120372

For example, if the name of cluster in vCenter has special character like "/",
vSphere api call will return the name as "cluster%2f01", which is encoded as
a url pattern, so that openstack nova vmware driver will fail to match this
cluster by name "cluster/01".

commit_message:
Decode special chars in vSphere objects' propset

For example, if the name of cluster in vCenter has special character like "/",
vSphere api call will return the name as "cluster%2f01", which is encoded as
a url pattern, so that openstack nova vmware driver will fail to match this
cluster by name "cluster/01".

This change will decode the special encoded characters into original values,
so that nova vmware driver will support name like "cluster/01" defined
in vCenter.

Change-Id: I478cc07e5f6a3bbaa3c13efbeb1cf0a8e0155422
Closes-Bug:#1412696

commit_message:
Add UUID Validation

This change adds a flag for enabling UUID validation
on the UUIDField Type.

It currently defaults to False, to allow Nova and other project to
continue with the current behaviour, but allow other projects to use
it.

There is a follow on patch that depricates the validate=False
and will force projects that cannot use this feature to explictily set
this to False.

There can then be an additional deprication cycle for that kwarg,
to make it always validate.

Change-Id: I738a27af41d0e0cb06e7aef65fccc55b1e46b687

subject: Adds value validation to the fields
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-08-11 16:24:22.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/exception.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Adds value validation to the fields

This introduce a concept of validation, which allows to check the values
of objects' fields when they are assigned.

FieldType class has got a new attribute '_validators', which is a list
of validators (functions of appropriate signature) and a 'validate'
method which iterates over the list of validators and checks
if the given value satisfies the conditions defined by those validators.

A validator is a function which accepts an object, an attribute name and
a value as paramters. It should return a tuple of a boolean and a
string, where string should contain a message to be included into
exception if the boolean is 'False'.

A Field class is mofified to call the 'validate' method of the
field_type object.

A developer may add any custom validators to any field (by passing a
list of functions / lambdas as a "validators" parameter of FieldType
constructor), but the validators for the most common field types are
included into this patch:
 - for String fields:
   - min_length - ensures the minimal length of a string
   - max_length - ensures the maximim length of a string
   - pattern - ensures that a string matches specific regex pattern

 - for Integer fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - multiple of - ensures that a value is a multiple of specific value

 - for Float fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum

 - for DateTime fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum

To add a convinient aliases for validatable fields of appropriate type
the 'AutoTypedField' class is improved. It addition to existing
'AUTO_TYPE' attribute a new one - called 'AUTO_TYPE_CLASS' - is added.
It defines the field type not as an instance, but as a class, which gets
instantiated in field's __init__, so each field type may be
parameterized with appropriate constraints.

Appropriate field types (StringField, IntegerField, FloatField,
DateTimeField) are modified to use this new functionality.

Depends-on: Ie20377e86134a5e8b68a93a08c26ed6f3025ae9d
(The dependency is needed, as otherwise nova's unit tests will be
broken: the change of enums to coerce their 'valid_values' modifies
the string representation of unicode fields)

Change-Id: I17328209b0b5334c24c893828e04ef19c7354148
'}]
commit_message:
Adds value validation to the fields

This introduce a concept of validation, which allows to check the values
of objects' fields when they are assigned.

FieldType class has got a new attribute '_validators', which is a list
of validators (functions of appropriate signature) and a 'validate'
method which iterates over the list of validators and checks
if the given value satisfies the conditions defined by those validators.

A validator is a function which accepts an object, an attribute name and
a value as paramters. It should return a tuple of a boolean and a
string, where string should contain a message to be included into
exception if the boolean is 'False'.

A Field class is mofified to call the 'validate' method of the
field_type object.

A developer may add any custom validators to any field (by passing a
list of functions / lambdas as a "validators" parameter of FieldType
constructor), but the validators for the most common field types are
included into this patch:
 - for String fields:
   - min_length - ensures the minimal length of a string
   - max_length - ensures the maximim length of a string
   - pattern - ensures that a string matches specific regex pattern

 - for Integer fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum
   - multiple of - ensures that a value is a multiple of specific value

 - for Float fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum

 - for DateTime fields:
   - minimum - ensures that a value is greater or equal than minimum
   - maximum - ensures that a value is lower or equal than maximum

To add a convinient aliases for validatable fields of appropriate type
the 'AutoTypedField' class is improved. It addition to existing
'AUTO_TYPE' attribute a new one - called 'AUTO_TYPE_CLASS' - is added.
It defines the field type not as an instance, but as a class, which gets
instantiated in field's __init__, so each field type may be
parameterized with appropriate constraints.

Appropriate field types (StringField, IntegerField, FloatField,
DateTimeField) are modified to use this new functionality.

Depends-on: Ie20377e86134a5e8b68a93a08c26ed6f3025ae9d
(The dependency is needed, as otherwise nova's unit tests will be
broken: the change of enums to coerce their 'valid_values' modifies
the string representation of unicode fields)

Change-Id: I17328209b0b5334c24c893828e04ef19c7354148

subject: Deprecate substituting jsonutils as a anyjson reference impl
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-12-10 07:05:29.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate substituting jsonutils as a anyjson reference impl

Since jsonutils is used across many many different projects
and libraries it does not seem safe or smart to have that file
when it is imported to forcefully tell anyjson that this newly loaded
module is the de-facto json impl.

This is especially problematic since jsonutils loads and dumps
do specific things that are mainly openstack specific and now those
openstack specific adjustments become forced onto any 3td party or
other library that also uses anyjson...

This can lead to unexpected incompatibilities that we are forcing onto
other anyjson using modules (without there understanding of this).

To avoid this in the future *start* to move away from all these above
problems by adding a deprecation message to the function that does
this logic, letting users of jsonutils know that this functionality
will be removed in the future.

Change-Id: Ifd4b817e00546e8e16e2866546e7112798647e70
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate substituting jsonutils as a anyjson reference impl

Since jsonutils is used across many many different projects
and libraries it does not seem safe or smart to have that file
when it is imported to forcefully tell anyjson that this newly loaded
module is the de-facto json impl.

This is especially problematic since jsonutils loads and dumps
do specific things that are mainly openstack specific and now those
openstack specific adjustments become forced onto any 3td party or
other library that also uses anyjson...

This can lead to unexpected incompatibilities that we are forcing onto
other anyjson using modules (without there understanding of this).

To avoid this in the future *start* to move away from all these above
problems by adding a deprecation message to the function that does
this logic, letting users of jsonutils know that this functionality
will be removed in the future.

Change-Id: Ifd4b817e00546e8e16e2866546e7112798647e70

commit_message:
Support RBAC with LDAP in oslo.policy

The end goal of this initiative is to support
Role Based Access Control with LDAP as backend.
This solution based on idea that user already
has configured permissions for users and this configuration
is stored in OpenLDAP or Active Directory.
The oslo.policy should be able to read permissions not only from policy.json
file but also from OpenLDAP/AD.

Spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256431/

Demo: https://vimeo.com/146109801

Implements: bp ldap-rbac

Change-Id: I7c8c32886e26e36ae5b66cb1e56a07e00bcd1fa3

subject: Retain reference to GroupAttrs in CORS middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-16 16:56:09.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/cors.py'], 'message': 'Retain reference to GroupAttrs in CORS middleware

This patch alters how detected configuration is stored inside
of the CORS Middleware. For legacy users, a new map is created
as previous. For configuration received via oslo_config, however,
the entire GroupAttr instance is stored. This approach ensures
that changes made to the configuration later during application
execution (such as calling set_defaults) are respected.

Change-Id: I84fb53610b18b12548fe9793e9a1f2dd53ba9e24
'}]
commit_message:
Retain reference to GroupAttrs in CORS middleware

This patch alters how detected configuration is stored inside
of the CORS Middleware. For legacy users, a new map is created
as previous. For configuration received via oslo_config, however,
the entire GroupAttr instance is stored. This approach ensures
that changes made to the configuration later during application
execution (such as calling set_defaults) are respected.

Change-Id: I84fb53610b18b12548fe9793e9a1f2dd53ba9e24

subject: To set qos_prefetch_count value to 64 (max_workers)
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-20 09:22:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'To set qos_prefetch_count value to 64 (max_workers)

It seems strange that we uses message ack together with qos=0.
Imagine that a RPC Server is stuck and all workers in a pool is blocked.
In this case AMQPListener still consume new messages from a queue and puts
them to the work queue of executor which does not have any limits.

So, the RPC Server does not respond, but we still consuming all messages
from the queue. I think this is not good.

Change-Id: Ib6b7a9c6aac65efb49ea2cbfcef9817287728e8e
'}]
commit_message:
To set qos_prefetch_count value to 64 (max_workers)

It seems strange that we uses message ack together with qos=0.
Imagine that a RPC Server is stuck and all workers in a pool is blocked.
In this case AMQPListener still consume new messages from a queue and puts
them to the work queue of executor which does not have any limits.

So, the RPC Server does not respond, but we still consuming all messages
from the queue. I think this is not good.

Change-Id: Ib6b7a9c6aac65efb49ea2cbfcef9817287728e8e

subject: should raise exception when rabbit broker has blocked the connection
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-17 16:55:26.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'should raise exception when rabbit broker has blocked the connection

For the case of rabbitMQ blocks and raise error, impl_rabbit also need
to raise exception to pass the err to consumer. Otherwise user of
oslo.messaging, i.e barbican, will hang forever for the message that failed
to deliver. For example, for the case like below,

2015-11-14 00:51:14.897 ERROR oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit
The broker has blocked the connection: low on disk

impl_rabbit.py need to raise proper exception.

Change-Id: Iea42c316f525989deb8b951606f74ee48595fd45
Closes-Bug: 1516745
'}]
commit_message:
should raise exception when rabbit broker has blocked the connection

For the case of rabbitMQ blocks and raise error, impl_rabbit also need
to raise exception to pass the err to consumer. Otherwise user of
oslo.messaging, i.e barbican, will hang forever for the message that failed
to deliver. For example, for the case like below,

2015-11-14 00:51:14.897 ERROR oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit
The broker has blocked the connection: low on disk

impl_rabbit.py need to raise proper exception.

Change-Id: Iea42c316f525989deb8b951606f74ee48595fd45
Closes-Bug: 1516745

subject: Add simple hmac adding and validating
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 15:40:42.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py'], 'message': "Add simple hmac adding and validating

This starts to add in some basic level of message validation
that can be used to verify that a message at least came from
a source that can produce the same hmac via the same shared
key and discards message that do not match the provided key.

If no key is provided to the 'deserialize_msg' and 'serialize_msg'
functions then they just continue to operate as before, but if
provided then they will validate and reject messages that do not
match the expected hmac.

This doesn't require the full kite integration or complex
key infrastructure that is required for something more advanced
but at least starts to add something that can provide some basic
level of sanity to messages.

Possible piece/part of blueprint trusted-messaging

Change-Id: Ife267673cd278e2173f0301667b067a8c6a602b0
"}]
commit_message:
Add simple hmac adding and validating

This starts to add in some basic level of message validation
that can be used to verify that a message at least came from
a source that can produce the same hmac via the same shared
key and discards message that do not match the provided key.

If no key is provided to the 'deserialize_msg' and 'serialize_msg'
functions then they just continue to operate as before, but if
provided then they will validate and reject messages that do not
match the expected hmac.

This doesn't require the full kite integration or complex
key infrastructure that is required for something more advanced
but at least starts to add something that can provide some basic
level of sanity to messages.

Possible piece/part of blueprint trusted-messaging

Change-Id: Ife267673cd278e2173f0301667b067a8c6a602b0

commit_message:
Allow msgpack as a envelope format

Make it so that it is possible to easily use msgpack
as a envelope format while still working with json by
default.

This bumps the minor version evelope version to denote
this and adds in a new evelope key/value that can define
one of the two possible formats (json or msgpack, defaulting
to json when not present to retain backwards compat).

Change-Id: I0576b3ad9b1383da537e743903217e1596055b2a

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Id9631081121c97036767173f440ba29ff4232d7c
Closes-Bug: #1530742

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-28 21:44:58.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/test_base.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/provision.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_provision.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Rework facade test fixtures to integrate w/ enginefacade

This patchset continues the work started local to
Neutron in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332476/ to
apply to oslo_db overall.   The provisioning system
now draws its database configuration from an enginefacade-oriented
factory.  The idea is that since projects typically make their
own enginefacade in their db/api.py module, this facade and all
of its configuration now serves as the factory for the test suite
as well.

Additionally, fixtures have been opened up to allow for a
"static SQL" fixture that keeps a single SQLite database open
without dropping it, support for deleting from tables as a teardown scheme,
and also moves out the "transactional" test concept from the
provisioning system and into a Fixture, as is more appropriate
for any setup/teardown that only spans a single test.

This is an incomplete WIP.

Closes-Bug: #1548960
Change-Id: I8780126d43ba8f3d5698729671655ffaa974d690
'}]
commit_message:
Rework facade test fixtures to integrate w/ enginefacade

This patchset continues the work started local to
Neutron in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332476/ to
apply to oslo_db overall.   The provisioning system
now draws its database configuration from an enginefacade-oriented
factory.  The idea is that since projects typically make their
own enginefacade in their db/api.py module, this facade and all
of its configuration now serves as the factory for the test suite
as well.

Additionally, fixtures have been opened up to allow for a
"static SQL" fixture that keeps a single SQLite database open
without dropping it, support for deleting from tables as a teardown scheme,
and also moves out the "transactional" test concept from the
provisioning system and into a Fixture, as is more appropriate
for any setup/teardown that only spans a single test.

This is an incomplete WIP.

Closes-Bug: #1548960
Change-Id: I8780126d43ba8f3d5698729671655ffaa974d690

commit_message:
Moved net-mtu extension definition

The module is not really imported from anywhere external to neutron, but
I am going to introduce a new extension that will allow to pass mtu on
create, and having both defined in a single place should keep it more
sane.

Change-Id: I41d5b399a6bd02f89f2e60c5ccb3fc0944b61255
Related-Bug: #1671634

subject: Use ipaddress module rather than netaddr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-25 21:03:06.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'oslo_config/types.py'], 'message': 'Use ipaddress module rather than netaddr

In profiling the load speed of openstackclient it was determined that
the majority of the oslo_config load time was spent in loading netaddr
which is only used for the IPAddress type.

The ipaddress module is available in the python stdlib as of python 3.3
however has been backported to python 2 and is much lighter weight so we
should use that for IP validation instead of netaddr.

Change-Id: If580ee33cb74f520fff109feb5caf0f6a47001e7
'}]
commit_message:
Use ipaddress module rather than netaddr

In profiling the load speed of openstackclient it was determined that
the majority of the oslo_config load time was spent in loading netaddr
which is only used for the IPAddress type.

The ipaddress module is available in the python stdlib as of python 3.3
however has been backported to python 2 and is much lighter weight so we
should use that for IP validation instead of netaddr.

Change-Id: If580ee33cb74f520fff109feb5caf0f6a47001e7

subject: Fix handling of old git log output
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-28 21:05:21.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_setup.py', 'pbr/git.py'], 'message': 'Fix handling of old git log output

Older versions of git produce log output (using --format specifiers)
that doesn't prefix tags with a "tag:" prefix, though they do using
the --decorate log format.  This was a bug in git that was fixed, but
the older git is still in the wild.  This change combines both the new
--format specifier method with the --decorate method to find tags even
if used with the old, buggy git, while (hopefully) avoiding
identifying non-tags as tags.

Change-Id: I6b557687f2428a528a8aa7f76e84797162488887
Closes-Bug: #1570458
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of old git log output

Older versions of git produce log output (using --format specifiers)
that doesn't prefix tags with a "tag:" prefix, though they do using
the --decorate log format.  This was a bug in git that was fixed, but
the older git is still in the wild.  This change combines both the new
--format specifier method with the --decorate method to find tags even
if used with the old, buggy git, while (hopefully) avoiding
identifying non-tags as tags.

Change-Id: I6b557687f2428a528a8aa7f76e84797162488887
Closes-Bug: #1570458

commit_message:
Make from_pip_string a little more robust

openstack/networking-midonet repository has old tags like 2015.1+1.0.rc0
and pbr crashes on them.  While these tags should probably be
just removed, it's better for pbr not to crash on them.

Closes-Bug: #1569680
Related-Bug: #1570145
Change-Id: I11d527a5b65ecb53eed848570d5cf6d30d1d33e7

subject: Added extras_require feature

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-09 14:41:01.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_setup.py', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/requirements.txt', 'pbr/tests/base.py', 'pbr/util.py', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/requirements.d/additional_reqs.txt', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Added extras_require feature

Reasons:
 - distutils allows to install additional dependencies:

	pip install distro[other_distro]

   setup.cfg example:

        [extras_require]
        env1 = req1 req2 req3 req4 ... reqN
        env2 = -r requirements.d/redirection.txt
               -r other_redirections.txt

 - as it can be seen pbr misses such feature

Changes:

 - added new test suit for testing extras_require feature
 - added new functionality to utils.py that reflects parsing
   of extras_require section from setup.cfg

Change-Id: I7fe1cc825dd6ea4b51964e04229fad54785b5ec3
'}]
commit_message:
Added extras_require feature

Reasons:
 - distutils allows to install additional dependencies:

	pip install distro[other_distro]

   setup.cfg example:

        [extras_require]
        env1 = req1 req2 req3 req4 ... reqN
        env2 = -r requirements.d/redirection.txt
               -r other_redirections.txt

 - as it can be seen pbr misses such feature

Changes:

 - added new test suit for testing extras_require feature
 - added new functionality to utils.py that reflects parsing
   of extras_require section from setup.cfg

Change-Id: I7fe1cc825dd6ea4b51964e04229fad54785b5ec3

commit_message:
Don't override package when set in .coveragerc

If the maintainer has explicitly set a run.source in .coveragerc
then respect that rather than automatically replacing it with the
discovered package name. Still allow it to be overridden on the
command line though.

Change-Id: If9be54e256ba85d640f2dab7b6211754896956fb

commit_message:
Escape some of the changelog RST messages

Commit messages themselves can contain contents that
cause sphinx (and other rst generating tools) to fail due
to being invalid or otherwise causing errors.

To resolve this we should try to escape changelog messages
so that they do not cause those tools to error out/die.

Part of fixes for bug #1499519

Change-Id: Ic6c7f5f6741a293fd4f061e1e0ab6f6afba25c76

commit_message:
Use diff --exit-code instead of --quiet

git diff --quiet has been reported to not return the expected exit
status in some circumstances (see
https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1264422). This change matches
what devstack does, and uses --exit-code instead of --quiet.

Change-Id: I7fcbf77d961bdd0d930b08a5bfc900c65cf73500
Closes-Bug: 1410434

subject: Fixed error use retry_on_disconnect decorator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-28 00:40:26.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/libvirt/inspector.py'], 'message': 'Fixed error use retry_on_disconnect decorator

This is wrong use for decorator @property without set method.
For retry_on_disconnect method, when raise libvirt.libvirtError
may be invoke self.connection = None which will raise
"AttributeError: can't set attribute". Because the invoke class has
not method for connection which decorator @connection.setter:

@connection.setter
def connection(self, value):
    self._connection = value

You can find how to use @property decorator over here:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#property

Change-Id: Idf6545c3a2c8aaafd220343d69b5dc7cc21d0a57
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed error use retry_on_disconnect decorator

This is wrong use for decorator @property without set method.
For retry_on_disconnect method, when raise libvirt.libvirtError
may be invoke self.connection = None which will raise
"AttributeError: can't set attribute". Because the invoke class has
not method for connection which decorator @connection.setter:

@connection.setter
def connection(self, value):
    self._connection = value

You can find how to use @property decorator over here:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#property

Change-Id: Idf6545c3a2c8aaafd220343d69b5dc7cc21d0a57

commit_message:
Move the unit test of NodesDiscoveryTripleO to the right directory

I am learning ceilometer unit test, and I found that the class
TestHardwareDiscovery in ceilometer/tests/unit/agent/test_discovery.py
was used to test the class NodesDiscoveryTripleO in
ceilometer/hardware/discovery.py.

I think it is better to mova it to the right directory and also change
its name form "TestHardwareDiscovery" to "TestNodesDiscoveryTripleO".

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ieecf7342152cc813ec3585a3b1873ac0dc13d804

neutron library has a good hacking rules set, we can use these rules
instead of reinvent the wheel. These such rules are:

- [N521] Validate that jsonutils module is used instead of json
- [N532] Validate that LOG.warning is used instead of LOG.warn. The
         latter is deprecated.

commit_message:
Using neutron-lib hacking rules

neutron library has a good hacking rules set, we can use these rules
instead of reinvent the wheel. These such rules are:

- [N521] Validate that jsonutils module is used instead of json
- [N532] Validate that LOG.warning is used instead of LOG.warn. The
         latter is deprecated.
- [N537] Don't translate logs.
- [N534] Exception messages should be translated
- [N529]  Method's default argument shouldn't be mutable!

Change-Id: Idf47b50d23e60a970f37041a3fed20dc44a5fd4f

subject: Return symlinks for encrypted volumes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 5997, 'name': 'Walt', 'display_name': 'Hemna', 'email': 'waboring@hemna.com', 'username': 'walter-boring', 'status': 'SAP'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19852, 'name': 'ITRI DISCO CI', 'email': 'itri_cinder@itri.org.tw', 'username': 'disco.ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22248, 'name': 'HPE STORAGE CI', 'email': 'hp.cinder.blr.ci@groups.ext.hpe.com', 'username': 'hp-storage-blr-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22796, 'name': 'Microsoft OSbrick CI', 'email': 'microsoft_osbrick_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_osbrick_ci'}, {'_account_id': 24502, 'name': 'Veritas HyperScale CI', 'email': 'DL-VTAS-ENG-SDIO-HyperScale-Opensource@veritas.com', 'username': 'veritas-hyperscale-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-13 12:39:40.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_iscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py'], 'message': "Return symlinks for encrypted volumes

When connecting encrypted volumes we need to return a symbolink link or
we will break all future attachments after detaching the volume.

OS-Brick on 1.14 and 1.15 returns real paths instead of returning symbolic
links, which results in the encryption attach_volume call replacing the
real device with a link to the crypt dm.

The issue comes from the Nova flow when attaching an encrypted volume:

1- Attach volume
2- Generate libvirt configuration with path from step 1
3- Encrypt attach volume

Since step 2 has already generated the config with the path from step 1 then
step 3 must preserve this path.

When step 1 returns a symbolic link we just forcefully replace it with a link
to the crypt dm and everything is OK, but when we return a real path it
does the same thing, which means we'll be replacing for example /dev/sda
with a symlink, which will then break the detach process, and all future
attachments.

Until Nova, Cinder, and OS-Brick are changed to have a different flow
(1, 3, 2) we need a workaround to make it work.

The workaround this patch introduces is to return a symbolic link when
the volume is encrypted.

It will try to return the symlink that always exists, but if it's not
there it will just look for ANY link to the device in '/dev/disk/by-id'.

Related-Bug: #1703954
Change-Id: If4461c3dcd67e5d948be9d9a3643c1eb81aaace9
"}]
commit_message:
Return symlinks for encrypted volumes

When connecting encrypted volumes we need to return a symbolink link or
we will break all future attachments after detaching the volume.

OS-Brick on 1.14 and 1.15 returns real paths instead of returning symbolic
links, which results in the encryption attach_volume call replacing the
real device with a link to the crypt dm.

The issue comes from the Nova flow when attaching an encrypted volume:

1- Attach volume
2- Generate libvirt configuration with path from step 1
3- Encrypt attach volume

Since step 2 has already generated the config with the path from step 1 then
step 3 must preserve this path.

When step 1 returns a symbolic link we just forcefully replace it with a link
to the crypt dm and everything is OK, but when we return a real path it
does the same thing, which means we'll be replacing for example /dev/sda
with a symlink, which will then break the detach process, and all future
attachments.

Until Nova, Cinder, and OS-Brick are changed to have a different flow
(1, 3, 2) we need a workaround to make it work.

The workaround this patch introduces is to return a symbolic link when
the volume is encrypted.

It will try to return the symlink that always exists, but if it's not
there it will just look for ANY link to the device in '/dev/disk/by-id'.

Related-Bug: #1703954
Change-Id: If4461c3dcd67e5d948be9d9a3643c1eb81aaace9

subject: Prefer my personal E-mail address
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 16:08:47.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst'], 'message': "Prefer my personal E-mail address

The E-mail provider used by the openstack.org domain rejects
messages failing DMARC checks, including many posts to popular
mailing lists such as those on lists.openstack.org and the
oss-security mailing list. Since I need to maintain subscriptions to
any lists on which I'll post advisories to keep myself whitelisted,
I'm going to switch to using the personal E-mail address I use for
all my other OpenStack-facing work (so that the contact address
published here for me remains consistent with the one I'm using to
author and send advisories going forward).

The OpenPGP key listed for me here already had a UID for this
address, so no change to the key is needed.

Change-Id: I8f716fdbf2ffbe70210d14c1749cbb9caaa0282d
"}]
commit_message:
Prefer my personal E-mail address

The E-mail provider used by the openstack.org domain rejects
messages failing DMARC checks, including many posts to popular
mailing lists such as those on lists.openstack.org and the
oss-security mailing list. Since I need to maintain subscriptions to
any lists on which I'll post advisories to keep myself whitelisted,
I'm going to switch to using the personal E-mail address I use for
all my other OpenStack-facing work (so that the contact address
published here for me remains consistent with the one I'm using to
author and send advisories going forward).

The OpenPGP key listed for me here already had a UID for this
address, so no change to the key is needed.

Change-Id: I8f716fdbf2ffbe70210d14c1749cbb9caaa0282d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-12 14:58:18.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/parameters.yaml'], 'message': "Fix api-ref for instance action events's attribute as optional

GET os-instance-actions API return 'events' in response which
is list of following elements:
{'event', 'start_time', 'finish_time', 'result', 'traceback'}

API ref mentioned those elements in 'events' response key as
mandatory which is not the case.

If no event is added in DB then 'events' key can be empty list.
Closes-Bug: #1703844

Change-Id: I2031e4da0c01683d679e50277a66220449399484
"}]
commit_message:
Fix api-ref for instance action events's attribute as optional

GET os-instance-actions API return 'events' in response which
is list of following elements:
{'event', 'start_time', 'finish_time', 'result', 'traceback'}

API ref mentioned those elements in 'events' response key as
mandatory which is not the case.

If no event is added in DB then 'events' key can be empty list.
Closes-Bug: #1703844

Change-Id: I2031e4da0c01683d679e50277a66220449399484

subject: Fix mysql client config generation with containerized environment
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-12 08:31:26.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/database/mysql/client.pp'], 'message': "Fix mysql client config generation with containerized environment

When the tripleo::profile::base::database::mysql::client profile is
included by other openstack services, the file /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf
is not generated because docker-puppet is configured to disregard the
exec tags.

Make the profile use either File or Exec resource based on how it's
being called, to make it work for both containerized and non-containerized
use cases.

Change-Id: I103baa02373f6713cc300ac039a6f173ff0bbf1c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mysql client config generation with containerized environment

When the tripleo::profile::base::database::mysql::client profile is
included by other openstack services, the file /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf
is not generated because docker-puppet is configured to disregard the
exec tags.

Make the profile use either File or Exec resource based on how it's
being called, to make it work for both containerized and non-containerized
use cases.

Change-Id: I103baa02373f6713cc300ac039a6f173ff0bbf1c

commit_message:
Install heat_native deps dynamically

This drops the hard coded requirement to install the
heat dependencies. These aren't required by default
because the Heat-All container is used instead. For those
using the native heat version this will provide the option
to install it dynamically as a package.

Change-Id: If035a32b32bbc2ec3d972c3be58e671778a68dc0

commit_message:
Update base-test to use new zuul-jobs roles

This exercises the new base roles in zuul-jobs.  It drops
openstack-zuul-roles from the base-test job, as well as the
workspace root variable which should no longer be needed.  It
also uses the new zuul_return method of reporting the log URL.

Change-Id: I93ce94c4e40b44a1f7a5cf6c5a8521ab71da5a5a
Depends-On: I7ac8d2335518c06808461f2fb30ea896709f09ed

commit_message:
Removed ovsdbapp deprecation warnings

neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py:47: DeprecationWarning: Class
'neutron.agent.ovsdb.native.connection.Connection' has moved to
'ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.connection.Connection'

neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py:57: DeprecationWarning:
neutron.agent.ovsdb.native.vlog.use_python_logger: moved to
ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.vlog.use_python_logger

The patch disabled a bunch of pylint checks for an existing line because
otherwise it triggers pylint failures. The workaround will be removed
later when the old API of ovsdbapp is no longer referred to.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If702b79152a67b04a262b37606e5649abd0057a1

commit_message:
Idempotent nova db privilege grants

The nova_api_galera_user is granted privileges for both the
nova_api_galera_database and nova_cell0_database. Use append_privs for
both of these tasks so that privileges aren't being overwritten and
re-added on each run of the playbook.

Change-Id: Ide9d44582bd1ecc126d198089ae9879163f61808

When we refactored the iSCSI connect mechanism we inadvertently changed

This patch fixes this and return the WWN as the value again.

This value is used by the encryption mechanism and expects it to be the

'}]
commit_message:
Return WWN in multipath_id

When we refactored the iSCSI connect mechanism we inadvertently changed
the value returned for the "multipath_id" key.

This patch fixes this and return the WWN as the value again.

This value is used by the encryption mechanism and expects it to be the
WWN.

Related-Bug: #1703954
Change-Id: Ia6d96a1e3a71488b44b3ca2323610a8f0a7cf675

subject: Remove calculation for NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-04 00:01:02.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/remove-neutron-dhcp-agents-per-network-1f34e5deeba71cda.yaml', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Remove calculation for NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork

This patch removes the calculation that set the
NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork configuration based on the number of
"controllers" being deployed. With composable roles, this is incorrect
and the default, if required, should be determined by the number of
neutron dhcp agent services being deployed - not a role count.

Closes-Bug: #1632721
Depends-On: I06628764c4769d91bbc42efe1c722702d6574d02
Change-Id: If202a8255f8ad9f662f0d66a5f630f1b7ae60a26
(cherry picked from commit 1051880e92a46a508bc92da01f4beb7a9203525b)
(cherry picked from commit 4a5fb3810ee23b59f10ee87251c6149b761c9daa)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove calculation for NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork

This patch removes the calculation that set the
NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork configuration based on the number of
"controllers" being deployed. With composable roles, this is incorrect
and the default, if required, should be determined by the number of
neutron dhcp agent services being deployed - not a role count.

Closes-Bug: #1632721
Depends-On: I06628764c4769d91bbc42efe1c722702d6574d02
Change-Id: If202a8255f8ad9f662f0d66a5f630f1b7ae60a26
(cherry picked from commit 1051880e92a46a508bc92da01f4beb7a9203525b)
(cherry picked from commit 4a5fb3810ee23b59f10ee87251c6149b761c9daa)

subject: Load Mistral workbooks via Python instead of Bash
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-12 17:57:39.000000000', 'files': ['instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'elements/undercloud-install/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/98-undercloud-setup', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'message': 'Load Mistral workbooks via Python instead of Bash

Calling openstack clients in a loop from bash is terribly slow. As
an example, during a recent undercloud upgrade I saw the process
take a full 3 minutes.  Doing this via Python instead results in a
runtime of 20-25 seconds.

Unit test coverage is also added since there was none.

Change-Id: I2d3576d30fcae74ea692bd712a40264004d9b9d1
'}]
commit_message:
Load Mistral workbooks via Python instead of Bash

Calling openstack clients in a loop from bash is terribly slow. As
an example, during a recent undercloud upgrade I saw the process
take a full 3 minutes.  Doing this via Python instead results in a
runtime of 20-25 seconds.

Unit test coverage is also added since there was none.

Change-Id: I2d3576d30fcae74ea692bd712a40264004d9b9d1

delegated to.

commit_message:

need_service_restart fact to prevent unnecessary restarts on subsequent

subject: Deprecate and don't build CentOS 6 images by default
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-13 08:07:16.000000000', 'files': ['tools/gate/build-images', 'diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh'], 'message': "Deprecate and don't build CentOS 6 images by default

Following the approved spec:
- do not automatically build centos (CentOS 6) images when no
  operating system is specified for a specific plugin;
- if 'centos' is explicitly specified, print out a warning message.
- whenever 'centos' is explicitly specified by the gate script,
  do not build it anymore.
Blueprint: deprecate-centos6-images
Change-Id: I4e11b97061d6e1f9804bae0157a345ed484d7dbe
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate and don't build CentOS 6 images by default

Following the approved spec:
- do not automatically build centos (CentOS 6) images when no
  operating system is specified for a specific plugin;
- if 'centos' is explicitly specified, print out a warning message.
- whenever 'centos' is explicitly specified by the gate script,
  do not build it anymore.
Blueprint: deprecate-centos6-images
Change-Id: I4e11b97061d6e1f9804bae0157a345ed484d7dbe

subject: Un-inline get/set_metatdata_chksum
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-06 18:01:40.000000000', 'files': ['include/erasurecode/erasurecode_helpers_ext.h', 'src/erasurecode_helpers.c', 'test/liberasurecode_test.c', 'src/erasurecode.c', 'src/erasurecode_postprocessing.c'], 'message': "Un-inline get/set_metatdata_chksum

Each was only really used in one place, they had some strange return types,
and recent versions of clang on OS X would refuse to compile with

erasurecode_helpers.c:531:26: error: taking address of packed member 'metadata_chksum' of
      class or structure 'fragment_header_s' may result in an unaligned pointer value
      [-Werror,-Waddress-of-packed-member]
    return (uint32_t *) &header->metadata_chksum;
                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

We don't really *care* about the pointer; we just want the value!

Change-Id: I8a5e42312948a75f5dd8b23b6f5ccfa7bd22eb1d
"}]
commit_message:
Un-inline get/set_metatdata_chksum

Each was only really used in one place, they had some strange return types,
and recent versions of clang on OS X would refuse to compile with

erasurecode_helpers.c:531:26: error: taking address of packed member 'metadata_chksum' of
      class or structure 'fragment_header_s' may result in an unaligned pointer value
      [-Werror,-Waddress-of-packed-member]
    return (uint32_t *) &header->metadata_chksum;
                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

We don't really *care* about the pointer; we just want the value!

Change-Id: I8a5e42312948a75f5dd8b23b6f5ccfa7bd22eb1d
