subject: Replace db sync check with alternative process
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-07-13 13:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/keystone_db_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Replace db sync check with alternative process

The keystone db sync --check option is only available
in Pike. Trying to use this option causes the db sync
processes to run every time the playbook is executed,
resulting in the keystone service being stopped. The
service is also never notified to restart, so it never
does.

This patch uses just the local facts to determine
whether or not to execute the db sync actions, and
properly notifies the service to restart afterwards.

Note:
This includes a re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/483309
which is different due to the fact that master exclusively uses uwsgi.

Change-Id: Ide64927e43e7684f03be7a73b893283c80e89afc
'}]
commit_message:
Replace db sync check with alternative process

The keystone db sync --check option is only available
in Pike. Trying to use this option causes the db sync
processes to run every time the playbook is executed,
resulting in the keystone service being stopped. The
service is also never notified to restart, so it never
does.

This patch uses just the local facts to determine
whether or not to execute the db sync actions, and
properly notifies the service to restart afterwards.

Note:
This includes a re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/483309
which is different due to the fact that master exclusively uses uwsgi.

Change-Id: Ide64927e43e7684f03be7a73b893283c80e89afc

subject: Ensure that keystone restarts after db sync
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-13 11:47:51.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/keystone_db_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure that keystone restarts after db sync

When the db expand/migrate options are required,
the keystone service is stopped but never notified
to start again. This patch ensures that it is
properly stopped, and properly notified.

Change-Id: Ide64927e43e7684f03be7a73b893283c80e89afc
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that keystone restarts after db sync

When the db expand/migrate options are required,
the keystone service is stopped but never notified
to start again. This patch ensures that it is
properly stopped, and properly notified.

Change-Id: Ide64927e43e7684f03be7a73b893283c80e89afc

subject: Add ability to debug OVS virtual environments
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-07-13 19:51:31.000000000', 'files': ['tools/debug_venv.py', 'ovsdbapp/tests/functional/base.py', 'TESTING.rst', 'tox.ini', 'tools/debug_venv'], 'message': 'Add ability to debug OVS virtual environments

When writing tests, it is useful to be able to look at the database
being modified. Since we use OVS virtual environments and delete
them when the test ends, this is difficult to do.

This patch adds the ability to pass KEEP_ENV=1 when running tox to
keep the virtual environment around and adds tools/debug_venv to
launch an OVS sandbox using the OVS virtual environment.

Change-Id: Idbec2d544d913ffa8888a050b8a53d016c0315f2
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to debug OVS virtual environments

When writing tests, it is useful to be able to look at the database
being modified. Since we use OVS virtual environments and delete
them when the test ends, this is difficult to do.

This patch adds the ability to pass KEEP_ENV=1 when running tox to
keep the virtual environment around and adds tools/debug_venv to
launch an OVS sandbox using the OVS virtual environment.

Change-Id: Idbec2d544d913ffa8888a050b8a53d016c0315f2

commit_message:
Netronome SmartNIC Enablement

This is a proof-of-concept patch set illustrating the proposed changes
to enable Netronome SmartNIC acceleration in OpenStack. This is not
intended to be mergeable. Extra parameters and branches have been tagged
by the "Agilio" keyword to stand out, the intent is to replace that with
generic "SmartNIC" vendor-neutral code.

Change-Id: I21fe789d43c9a96c4975bce99c7197c4038a1b3e
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

commit_message:
Sort key-value pairs in backend dictionaries

The items within each cinder backend section is currently templated as
an unsorted dictionary. Sort them to avoid unnecessary config changes
and service restarts.

Change-Id: I48a0bd5dc294ec5bc142537c6e74d57a25fda5e4
(cherry picked from commit 849677b052d7392512a76d0afeae84981929fb8b)

commit_message:
Netronome SmartNIC Enablement

This is a proof-of-concept patch set illustrating the proposed changes
to enable Netronome SmartNIC acceleration in OpenStack. This is not
intended to be mergeable. Extra parameters and branches have been tagged
by the "Agilio" keyword to stand out, the intent is to replace that with
generic "SmartNIC" vendor-neutral code.

Change-Id: Ib8007a27a0d2292e6b4e025509f0a56bf06f9bee
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-06 17:43:03.000000000', 'files': ['src/Makefile.am', 'src/erasurecode_helpers.c', 'bindep.txt', 'erasurecode.pc.in', 'test/liberasurecode_test.c', 'src/utils/chksum/crc32.c', 'src/erasurecode.c', 'test/Makefile.am', 'include/erasurecode/alg_sig.h'], 'message': "Use zlib for CRC-32

Previously, we had our own CRC that was almost but not quite like
zlib's implementation. However,

* it hasn't been subjected to the same rigor with regard to error-detection
  properties and
* it may not even get used, depending upon whether zlib happens to get
  loaded before or after liberasurecode.

Now, we'll use zlib's CRC-32 when writing new frags, while still
tolerating frags that were created with the old implementation.

Change-Id: Ib5ea2a830c7c23d66bf2ca404a3eb84ad00c5bc5
Closes-Bug: 1666320
"}]
commit_message:
Use zlib for CRC-32

Previously, we had our own CRC that was almost but not quite like
zlib's implementation. However,

* it hasn't been subjected to the same rigor with regard to error-detection
  properties and
* it may not even get used, depending upon whether zlib happens to get
  loaded before or after liberasurecode.

Now, we'll use zlib's CRC-32 when writing new frags, while still
tolerating frags that were created with the old implementation.

Change-Id: Ib5ea2a830c7c23d66bf2ca404a3eb84ad00c5bc5
Closes-Bug: 1666320

subject: Stop pretending to support SSE4-optimized CRC-32C
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 00:14:08.000000000', 'files': ['src/utils/chksum/crc32.c'], 'message': "Stop pretending to support SSE4-optimized CRC-32C

It isn't the CRC we want, and we never used it anyway. While we may
define INTEL_SSE41 or INTEL_SSE42 if CPU seems to support it, we've
never defined INTEL_SSE4.

Change-Id: I04e1dd6458ccde58a0a2f3f4d6947569a31e9697
Partial-Bug: 1666320
"}]
commit_message:
Stop pretending to support SSE4-optimized CRC-32C

It isn't the CRC we want, and we never used it anyway. While we may
define INTEL_SSE41 or INTEL_SSE42 if CPU seems to support it, we've
never defined INTEL_SSE4.

Change-Id: I04e1dd6458ccde58a0a2f3f4d6947569a31e9697
Partial-Bug: 1666320

commit_message:
Sort key-value pairs in backend dictionaries

The items within each cinder backend section is currently templated as
an unsorted dictionary. Sort them to avoid unnecessary config changes
and service restarts.

 Conflicts:
	templates/cinder.conf.j2

Change-Id: I48a0bd5dc294ec5bc142537c6e74d57a25fda5e4

subject: Fail-fast if the undercloud-passwords.conf file is missing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 15:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'message': 'Fail-fast if the undercloud-passwords.conf file is missing

On undercloud updates/upgrades, if the undercloud-passwords.conf
file was deleted or moved it will break some services because there
are passwords that cannot be changed.  This validates that the file
exists and stops immediately with a message explaining the problem
if the file is missing.

Change-Id: Ic83d6afc8dc2128874b97cc414ea28272e7d6639
Closes-Bug: 1702709
'}]
commit_message:
Fail-fast if the undercloud-passwords.conf file is missing

On undercloud updates/upgrades, if the undercloud-passwords.conf
file was deleted or moved it will break some services because there
are passwords that cannot be changed.  This validates that the file
exists and stops immediately with a message explaining the problem
if the file is missing.

Change-Id: Ic83d6afc8dc2128874b97cc414ea28272e7d6639
Closes-Bug: 1702709

subject: Refactor iDRAC is ready functionality
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7160, 'name': 'arkady kanevsky', 'email': 'akanevsk@redhat.com', 'username': 'arkady'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10250, 'name': 'Christopher Dearborn', 'email': 'Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com', 'username': 'cdearbor'}, {'_account_id': 10379, 'name': 'Rajini Karthik', 'email': 'rrajini@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajinir'}, {'_account_id': 23847, 'name': 'Richard G. Pioso', 'email': 'richard.pioso@dell.com', 'username': 'richard.pioso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-11 01:32:28.000000000', 'files': ['dracclient/tests/test_lifecycle_controller.py', 'dracclient/tests/test_client.py', 'dracclient/client.py', 'dracclient/resources/lifecycle_controller.py'], 'message': 'Refactor iDRAC is ready functionality

Web Services Management (WS-Management and WS-Man) requests/commands can
fail or return invalid results when issued to an Integrated Dell Remote
Access Controller (iDRAC) whose Lifecycle Controller remote service is
not "ready". Specifically, that applies to the WS-Man Enumerate and
Invoke operations.

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", states that for Lifecycle Controller firmware
1.5.0 and later "The Lifecycle Controller remote service must be in a
'ready' state before running any other WSMAN commands." That applies to
almost all of the workflows and use cases documented by that paper and
supported by this project, openstack/python-dracclient. That document
describes how to determine the readiness of the Lifecycle Controller
remote service. A project commit [1] implements that.

This refactors that patch in preparation for changing the internal
implementation of the project's APIs so that they follow that best
practice. The implementation of is_idrac_ready() and
wait_until_idrac_is_ready() have been relocated further down the call
stack, to the iDRAC specialization of the WS-Man client defined by class
dracclient.client.WSManClient. Those methods continue to be available
through the API provided by class dracclient.client.Client.

No changes have been made to this project's APIs nor to any functional
behavior.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332
[1]
https://github.com/openstack/python-dracclient/commit/39253bb272a7d4cfcc161c19708b8c6949a21240

Change-Id: I87996bbca129995f6c84848ebdb0c33cfedeea53
Partial-Bug: #1697558
Related-Bug: #1691808'}]
commit_message:
Refactor iDRAC is ready functionality

Web Services Management (WS-Management and WS-Man) requests/commands can
fail or return invalid results when issued to an Integrated Dell Remote
Access Controller (iDRAC) whose Lifecycle Controller remote service is
not "ready". Specifically, that applies to the WS-Man Enumerate and
Invoke operations.

A Dell technical white paper [0], "Lifecycle Controller Integration --
Best Practices Guide", states that for Lifecycle Controller firmware
1.5.0 and later "The Lifecycle Controller remote service must be in a
'ready' state before running any other WSMAN commands." That applies to
almost all of the workflows and use cases documented by that paper and
supported by this project, openstack/python-dracclient. That document
describes how to determine the readiness of the Lifecycle Controller
remote service. A project commit [1] implements that.

This refactors that patch in preparation for changing the internal
implementation of the project's APIs so that they follow that best
practice. The implementation of is_idrac_ready() and
wait_until_idrac_is_ready() have been relocated further down the call
stack, to the iDRAC specialization of the WS-Man client defined by class
dracclient.client.WSManClient. Those methods continue to be available
through the API provided by class dracclient.client.Client.

No changes have been made to this project's APIs nor to any functional
behavior.

[0]
http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20442332
[1]
https://github.com/openstack/python-dracclient/commit/39253bb272a7d4cfcc161c19708b8c6949a21240

Change-Id: I87996bbca129995f6c84848ebdb0c33cfedeea53
Partial-Bug: #1697558
Related-Bug: #1691808

Live Migration calls initialize_connection multiple times.
Nimble Storage needs to ignore additional calls in initialize_connection
for access_control_records

In Ocata the interface is REST based whereas in Newton it was SOAP
based.  As a result a cherry-pick was not possible.

Closes-Bug: #1481953
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for live migration for Nimble Storage

Live Migration calls initialize_connection multiple times.
Nimble Storage needs to ignore additional calls in initialize_connection
for access_control_records

In Ocata the interface is REST based whereas in Newton it was SOAP
based.  As a result a cherry-pick was not possible.

Change-Id: Ibacf0ebca55c51bf9a2cdcc9bb1d161d3f83b556
Closes-Bug: #1481953

revisions:

This is set via all_nodes_config in t-h-t, but it's a special case for

commit_message:
Remove dependency on memcached_node_ips_v6

This is set via all_nodes_config in t-h-t, but it's a special case for
this service, so it'll be better if we handle the ipv6 transformation
in puppet instead of relying on the service specific list mangling in
t-h-t (one aspect of which has been identified as a potential performance
problem).

Related-Bug: #1684272
Change-Id: Iccb9089db4b382db3adb9340f18f6d2364ca7f58

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded enable_load_balancer from Controller role

This is associated with the haproxy service, so set the hieradata there
instead.  This is needed so we can render the controller role template
via j2, and also if anyone ever wants to run haproxy on some role other
then the Controller.

Change-Id: I82b992afe42f6da7788f6efca2366863c3bf68f7
Partially-Implements: blueprint composable-networks

revisions:

Add new overcloud cli command in order to dump
all the configs from the overcloud contains in role_data.
All different type of configs are dump in a separate file
per role ex:
ls config/tmpD2nDOd-config/
config_settings-Compute.yaml
global_config_settings-Compute.yaml
logging_sources-Compute.yaml

the upgrade tasks via ansible on the Undercloud.

Change-Id: I7d89ffde8a19b30aaf59efb11e41d32cfa644b83
Closes-bug: #1665585
'}]
commit_message:
Dump all deployment role_data files to a config dir

Add new overcloud cli command in order to dump
all the configs from the overcloud contains in role_data.
All different type of configs are dump in a separate file
per role ex:
ls config/tmpD2nDOd-config/
config_settings-Compute.yaml
global_config_settings-Compute.yaml
logging_sources-Compute.yaml
monitoring_subscriptions-Compute.yaml
service_config_settings-Compute.yaml
service_metadata_settings-Compute.yaml
service_names-Compute.yaml
step_config-Compute.yaml
upgrade_batch_tasks-Compute.yaml
upgrade_tasks-Compute.yaml

The upgrade_tasks is in yaml format and can be directly
call with ansible-playbook command, example:

$ cat config/tmpD2nDOd-config/upgrade_tasks-Compute.yaml
- hosts: Compute
  name: Compute playbook
  tasks:
  - name: Stop snmp service
    service: name=snmpd state=stopped
    tags: step1
  - name: Stop nova-compute service
    service: name=openstack-nova-compute state=stopped
    tags: step1

This patch to allow operators to run manually
the upgrade tasks via ansible on the Undercloud.

Change-Id: I7d89ffde8a19b30aaf59efb11e41d32cfa644b83
Closes-bug: #1665585

subject: Remove update abort
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-07 17:41:24.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/actions/package_update.py', 'workbooks/package_update.yaml', 'tripleo_common/tests/test_stack_update.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tripleo_common/_stack_update.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_package_update.py', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-abort-7214f376c9672644.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove update abort

The update abort is not reliable, and could mess up a TripleO stack
beyond repair. Since this has a potential for data loss, I would
suggest this be removed without a deprecation period.

Change-Id: I752e061979d667c1fb2b115c1a7339002e1824d5

commit_message:
Remove update abort

The update abort is not reliable, and could mess up a TripleO stack
beyond repair. Since this has a potential for data loss, I would
suggest this be removed without a deprecation period.

Depends-On: Ieec4f01e38768eafb3df1f06340bdd3e220d30bd

Change-Id: I752e061979d667c1fb2b115c1a7339002e1824d5
Related-Bug: #1668269
(cherry picked from commit b14c0f727e65de9dbc76160730b413ddac4a54e9)

subject: Added OvS permission workaround for enabling DPDK
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-10 10:49:55.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ovs-dpdk-permission-workaround-20aaebcc8d6009ec.yaml', 'extraconfig/pre_network/host_config_and_reboot.yaml'], 'message': 'Added OvS permission workaround for enabling DPDK

The vhost sockets sockets are created with qemu permission, but ovs
runs with root permission. In order to allow ovs to access vhost sockets
reducing the ovs group permission from root to qemu. This is a temprovary

both ovs2.6 and ovs2.7 versions.

Change-Id: I172956390c19fc9824bf7590cd48bfcf6201191b
'}]
commit_message:
Added OvS permission workaround for enabling DPDK

The vhost sockets sockets are created with qemu permission, but ovs
runs with root permission. In order to allow ovs to access vhost sockets
reducing the ovs group permission from root to qemu. This is a temprovary
workaround, until ovs fixes the permission issue. The script supports
both ovs2.6 and ovs2.7 versions.

Change-Id: I172956390c19fc9824bf7590cd48bfcf6201191b

commit_message:
Log warning when API version is not specified for the OSC plugin

At the Pike PTG, an issue was brought up regarding the use of an old API
version in the ironic OpenStack CLI plugin. [0]

It was suggested that we begin printing a warning whenever the default
OSC API version is used and later default to using the latest API
version when --os-baremetal-api-version is unspecified.

This patch adds the warning discussed above.

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ironic-pike-ptg-operations L30

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1671145
Change-Id: I0cf4e737595405b7f9beff76a72ffd26e07e6277

runs of the playbook.

commit_message:
Remove unused None from dict.get()

Since the default value is None when can't get a key from a dict,
So there is no need to use dict.get('key', None).

Change-Id: I9f2ea40e13a63992170149936ae4e80b8969c023

These are the last two remaining 'connection: local' plays.
We set the python interpreter to be used as the host instead
of the Ansible venv. This resolves the issue with the venv

libraries.

Change-Id: Ib4726afbaad1e084e9126202706114bfec5585c2

commit_message:
Set python interpreter for connection:local plays

These are the last two remaining 'connection: local' plays.
We set the python interpreter to be used as the host instead
of the Ansible venv. This resolves the issue with the venv
being python3 but the playbook modules requiring python2
libraries.

Change-Id: Ib4726afbaad1e084e9126202706114bfec5585c2

commit_message:
Migrate Cinder CLI Quota docs

Another riveting chapter in the Cinder docs migration!

This patch brings over the CLI Quota related documentation
from openstack-manuals. It includes how to set quotas
as well as the Cinder specific documentation.

As with the other patches, this is just intended to migrate
the content so it is once again accessible. Improvements/changes
to the documentation can come with follow-on patches.

Change-Id: Id5a41b0ebb59ec8db9a80eb1effb873da65140f6

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

sushy already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I33a0c93a937582d6efeb8a2164cbd92de99a05a0

commit_message:
tests: Convert bind configuration file to template

It's better to use a single template file for the bind configuration
instead of using a copy for each distribution. The new template file
is based on the configuration files from Ubuntu, CentOS and openSUSE.

Change-Id: I85ec991d4761db891c624c9495ccc97c7d08dfe3

subject: Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions
revisions:

Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions. Nothing special is
required for this except for adding the appropriate distro variables
file and also update the zypper cache before package installation.
Moreover, for tests to pass, we need to use the OBS repository to
install the MongoDB packages since they are not provided in the default
openSUSE distribution repositories for Leap < 42.3

Change-Id: Ifa3968f7f578174cf12737c758fa2bca30393fb0

commit_message:
Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions

Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions. Nothing special is
required for this except for adding the appropriate distro variables
file and also update the zypper cache before package installation.
Moreover, for tests to pass, we need to use the OBS repository to
install the MongoDB packages since they are not provided in the default
openSUSE distribution repositories for Leap < 42.3

Change-Id: Ifa3968f7f578174cf12737c758fa2bca30393fb0

allocation requests for each instance that was claimed. The first
allocation request in the list is the one that was used in the

represent possible alternate destinations for the workload if the
launch request ends up failing on the originally-targeted host. All
alternate allocation requests will be for compute nodes in the same

commit_message:
placement: claim resources in filter scheduler

This patch adds the bulk of the code for claiming resources for
instances against a particular host during the primary _schedule() loop
in the filter scheduler. Because the state objects are tightly coupled
to the way that the filters and weighers operate in the filter
scheduler driver, we need to co-locate the claim resources code with
the code that loops through the filters and weighers.

In the code submitted here, we attempt to claim resources for each
instance in spec_obj.num_instances. For each of *those* attempts, we
keep trying to claim the resources against each host in the weighed
list of hosts returned in each loop after calling the host manager
get_filtered_hosts() method. If we fail to claim against a particular
host, we try another allocation request that matches that compute node.
If those all fail, we try the next host in the weighed hosts list.

Only if we successfully claim (in the placement API) resources for an
instance against a host do we call the host state object's
consume_from_instance() method or modify the spec_obj's instance group
state tracking. This ensures that logic around instance group affinity
and anti-affinity as well as logic that reduces resource capacity in
the host state objects only occurs if we've actually successfully
claimed resources in the placement API.

Finally, after successfully claiming resources for an instance, we
return a dict, keyed by instance UUID, that contains a list of the
allocation requests for each instance that was claimed. The first
allocation request in the list is the one that was used in the
successful claim for that instance. The remaining allocation requests
represent possible alternate destinations for the workload if the
launch request ends up failing on the originally-targeted host. All
alternate allocation requests will be for compute nodes in the same
cell as the originally-selected host.

Change-Id: Iaf3f8e688432246f0ac3b95508cc216bad771e8c
blueprint: placement-claims
blueprint: placement-allocation-requests

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-11 23:00:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/fakes.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_filter_scheduler.py'], 'message': "scheduler: alternates for filter scheduler

After trying to fit the square peg of allocations into the round hole
that is the current design of the scheduler, I realized that due to the
way that state is kept in the host manager and the scheduler driver,
that I would unfortunately not be able to isolate the claim logic in
the scheduler manager. Instead, due to the way that the host state
objects are passed into the filters and weighers and modified in the
filter scheduler driver's _schedule() method, it is not possible to
pull the logic for retrying a claim into a higher abstraction layer.
The coupling is just too tight between the state (host objects) and the
calling interface itself (select_destinations()).

And so this patch sets the stage for retrying claims from within the
filter scheduler's _schedule() method -- which is the method where the
state objects are being modified. We change the _schedule() method to
return a dict, keyed by instance UUID, containing lists of hosts
ordered by fitness. This dict will eventually be used to return the
list of alternate hosts for each scheduled instance, but for now, and
for the next patch which adds calls to placement to claim resources
during the filter scheduler driver's _schedule() method, we keep the
generation of alternate hosts isolated within the filter scheduler
driver only.

Change-Id: I10cdfd3a28c1936d7e9a3bb56b4639e29e31a4f8
blueprint: placement-claims
blueprint: placement-allocation-requests
"}]
commit_message:
scheduler: alternates for filter scheduler

After trying to fit the square peg of allocations into the round hole
that is the current design of the scheduler, I realized that due to the
way that state is kept in the host manager and the scheduler driver,
that I would unfortunately not be able to isolate the claim logic in
the scheduler manager. Instead, due to the way that the host state
objects are passed into the filters and weighers and modified in the
filter scheduler driver's _schedule() method, it is not possible to
pull the logic for retrying a claim into a higher abstraction layer.
The coupling is just too tight between the state (host objects) and the
calling interface itself (select_destinations()).

And so this patch sets the stage for retrying claims from within the
filter scheduler's _schedule() method -- which is the method where the
state objects are being modified. We change the _schedule() method to
return a dict, keyed by instance UUID, containing lists of hosts
ordered by fitness. This dict will eventually be used to return the
list of alternate hosts for each scheduled instance, but for now, and
for the next patch which adds calls to placement to claim resources
during the filter scheduler driver's _schedule() method, we keep the
generation of alternate hosts isolated within the filter scheduler
driver only.

Change-Id: I10cdfd3a28c1936d7e9a3bb56b4639e29e31a4f8
blueprint: placement-claims
blueprint: placement-allocation-requests

1.if rp create failed because of endpoint,

2.delete two update_resource_stats in init_compute_node() in rt, because the empty stats

commit_message:
fix empty stats of compute_node and rp created failed while placement endpoint created after nova-compute start

1.if rp create failed because of endpoint,
  report-client reload keystone session and  raise exception.
  rt catch the exception and init the old_resource, cause _update()
  call report-client again next period.

2.delete two update_resource_stats in init_compute_node() in rt, because the empty stats
  and init numa_topology will update by init_compute_node(), bug right value of
  stats and numa_topology get after init_compute_node() will not update to db while
   _update() thought the resuorce was not changed compared to old_resource in memory.
  so, the wrong stats and numa_topology stay in db most of time.

Change-Id: Ifa17d0ceda6c5aa92ef4f9dfad964993d6c1691c
Related-Bug: #1697825
Related-Bug: #1697820

subject: Fixed error use retry_on_disconnect decorator
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-27 05:07:02.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/libvirt/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/compute/discovery.py'], 'message': 'Fixed error use retry_on_disconnect decorator

This is wrong use for decorator @property without set method.
For retry_on_disconnect method, when raise libvirt.libvirtError
may be invoke self.connection = None which will raise
"AttributeError: can't set attribute". Because the invoke class has
not method for connection which decorator @connection.setter:

@connection.setter
def connection(self, value):
    self._connection = value

You can find how to use @property decorator over here:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#property

Change-Id: I3d5f3e8182ddad30d7ed33607451b799eec8aaaa
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed error use retry_on_disconnect decorator

This is wrong use for decorator @property without set method.
For retry_on_disconnect method, when raise libvirt.libvirtError
may be invoke self.connection = None which will raise
"AttributeError: can't set attribute". Because the invoke class has
not method for connection which decorator @connection.setter:

@connection.setter
def connection(self, value):
    self._connection = value

You can find how to use @property decorator over here:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#property

Change-Id: I3d5f3e8182ddad30d7ed33607451b799eec8aaaa

commit_message:
Netronome SmartNIC Enablement

This is a proof-of-concept patch set illustrating the proposed changes
to enable Netronome SmartNIC acceleration in OpenStack. This is not
intended to be mergeable. Extra parameters and branches have been tagged
by the "Agilio" keyword to stand out, the intent is to replace that with
generic "SmartNIC" vendor-neutral code.

Change-Id: I17da5568fb8edb01a3904e7f6f4f749f60a7fd87
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
